title: 5 Shot at Teen Concert in Kansas City
content:
Error loading player: No playable sources found
KANSAS CITY, Mo. -- A night of fun turns into a night of fear as a teen party ends with five people shot in southeast Kansas City early Sunday.
The parking lot at the Tropical Palms is littered with blood, cans and crime tape.
Police were called to the banquet hall at 84th Street and Hillcrest Road just before midnight after someone started shooting inside the building where about 150 teenagers had been attending a concert.
According to police, the shooting then continued into the parking lot.
"The investigation is in its early stages," said Sgt. Marisa Barnes, a police spokeswoman. "There are three victims who are in serious but stable condition, and two that are in critical but stable condition."
Part of the agreement for holding an event at the Tropical Palms is providing adequate security.
The owner of the banquet hall says he is not sure how many security guards were working Saturday night, but he does believe the building's cameras caught most of the incident on video.
Police are currently reviewing the footage.
Police say despite the large crowd, they have limited suspect information. But witnesses saw four people drive away from the banquet hall just after the shooting.
No one is in custody yet.
(story by KCTV, Kansas City)
